## Should you buy the Samsung Galaxy S7?

The Galaxy S7 wraps a fast Exynos 8890 processor, stunning camera and sleek
Android interface inside a svelte, shiny package clad in scratch-resistant
Gorilla Glass 4. It also carries an IP68 waterproof rating, which means you
can dunk it in 1m of water for up to 30 minutes without killing it.

It might not be Sammy’s latest and greatest smartphone, but going into 2018
it’s still one of the most popular top-performing smartphones on the market.
If you ask us, it’s a great choice if you’re after a fast and reliable Android
phone that won’t break the bank.

work and home.

## Best Samsung Galaxy S7 deals – 8GB to 30GB

A deal in between around 8GB and 10GB should suit the average phone user who
makes the most out of their 4G allowance while on the go. It’s advisable to
grab a deal with more than 10GB if you’re prone to watching lots of videos,
gaming, streaming and the like when you’re commuting, waiting for friends or
killing some time away from home. Of course, if your appetite for internet is
off the scale, then a deal pushing 20GB or 30GB is your best option.

Most of the deals we spotted on the Galaxy S7 in this data range ask for
nothing upfront before the phone is yours, so it’s easy to see which price
plan suits you. Three’s generous 8GB deal is a clear winner in terms of value
for money at the 8GB point, while its 30GB deal gives data hoggers the luxury
